[SPELLING]: Repeated use of "the stuff" and "a stuff" instead of "he" or "the man"
[SYNTAX]: Awkward placement of adverbs ("He became soon a painter")

[CLARITY]: Confusing references to "the stuff" disrupting narrative flow
Ambiguous use of "the thing" in art historical discussions
[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt transitions between Reynolds' early life and later achievements
[LOGIC]: Unclear contextual references in final paragraph (e.g., "the two unfortunate accidents")

[SYNTAX]: Awkward phrasing in "acting on the advice of his friend and patron, Lord Edgcumbe."
Disjointed structure in "He was vulgar, until he learned refinement..." (misuse of "until").
Wordy and awkward phrasing in "the coach in which his unfortunate sister Frances was compelled to drive..."
[LEXICON]: Unclear word choice in "better suited to the growing claims of sitters."
[SPELLING]: Possible typo in "a thing Romney" (likely "the painter Romney").

[LOGIC]: Abrupt shift from Reynolds’ professional success to his personal weaknesses.
[CLARITY]: Unclear reference to "the thing" in "when he established himself in the thing."
[STRUCTURE]: Disjointed transition between paragraphs on Reynolds’ friendships and his flaws.
[TRANSITION]: Weak connection between Dr. Johnson’s influence and Reynolds’ social circle.
